issues.details: Trump lifted the Biden-era cap on U.S. AI chip exports to the UAE, sparking debate over potential technology spillâ€‘over to rival nations.
The Saudi Crown Princeâ€™s meeting with Trump led to a U.S.â€“Saudi AI memorandum, raising questions about the strategic use of U.S. technology in the region.
Lutnick said the export approval was delayed until the UAEâ€™s investment commitments were finalized, prompting criticism of bureaucratic bottlenecks.

responses.clarification: The Commerce Department granted the export license only after the UAEâ€™s investment in AI infrastructure was completed.

responses.issue: Lifting of AI chip export caps
responses.clarification: Trump announced the removal of the cap on U.S. AI chip exports to the UAE during his May 2025 Middle East visit.

evaluations.opinion: The U.S. aims to preserve its AI leadership while expanding influence in the Gulf.
The delay in approvals reflects lingering concerns about technology transfer to rival states.

confirmed_facts: U.S. Commerce Department approved the export of up to 35,000 Nvidia Blackwell chips to UAEâ€™s G42 and Saudi Arabiaâ€™s Humain.
The Korean GPU supply of 260,000 units is reported as uncertain following the U.S. export approval.
unconfirmed_allegations: The Korean GPU supply will be directly impacted by the U.S. export approval to the Middle East.

timeline.event: Trump announces removal of U.S. AI chip export cap to the UAE.
U.S. Commerce Department grants export license for up to 35,000 Blackwell chips to UAE and Saudi Arabia.
Article reports the export approval and notes uncertainty in Korean GPU supply.
